app.title: LLM Random Number Analysis
app.numbersGeneratedButAnalysisNotAvailable: Numbers generated but analysis not available. Runs: {{current}}/{{total}}

controlPanel.numberCountBatchTitle: Number count is specified in the system prompt when using batch mode
controlPanel.numberOfRunsTitle: Number of independent runs to perform
controlPanel.csvColumnsInstruction: Columns must be named: run 1, run 2, run 3, etc.
controlPanel.csvNumericInstruction: Each column should contain numeric values (one per row).
controlPanel.pleaseSelectCsv: Please select a CSV file (.csv extension)
controlPanel.dummyDataHint: Loads test data from dummy_data.json file. Supports both single array [x,x,x] and multi-run [[x,x,x], [x,x,x]] formats.
controlPanel.userPromptPlaceholder: Optional. Leave empty to send only the system prompt to the LLM.
controlPanel.userPromptHint: Leave empty to send only the system prompt; no user message is sent.
controlPanel.apiKeyHint: If set, this overrides the key from the server's .env. Used for OpenAI, Anthropic, or DeepSeek when generating.
controlPanel.apiKeyPlaceholder: sk-... or your provider API key
controlPanel.defaultPromptOneByOne: You are a random number generator. Generate a single random number between 0 and 1. Respond with ONLY the number, no explanation, no formatting, just the decimal number.
controlPanel.defaultPromptBatch: You are a random number generator. Generate exactly {{count}} random numbers between 0 and 1. Return them in CSV format, one number per line. Only return the numbers, no explanation, no formatting, no headers.

numberStream.title: Number Stream
numberStream.noNumbersYet: No numbers generated yet. Click "Generate Random Numbers" to start.
numberStream.andMore: ... and {{count}} more (click any number to expand)

dashboard.downloadPdfTitle: Download full analysis report as PDF

statsDashboard.errorDownloadingCsv: Error downloading CSV file. Please try again.
statsDashboard.errorDownloadingPdf: Error downloading PDF file. Please try again.

perRun.runAnalysisDesc: Detailed statistical analysis for Run {{n}} ({{count}} numbers)

multiRun.analysisAcrossRuns: Analysis across {{numRuns}} runs, {{countPerRun}} numbers per run
multiRun.nistLongestRunOfOnes: NIST Longest Run of Ones Test
multiRun.combinedStreamDesc: The statistics below are calculated from all numbers across all runs treated as a single stream of data. Each value is computed on the concatenation of every run, so they describe the overall distribution of the full dataset.
multiRun.clickRowToViewDetail: Click on a row to view detailed statistics for that run
multiRun.frequencyHistogramKde: Frequency Histogram / KDE Across All Runs
multiRun.distributionAcrossRuns: Distribution of number frequencies across all {{n}} runs
multiRun.hoverBoxPlot: Hover over a box plot to see detailed statistics for that run
multiRun.eachLineEcdf: Each line represents the ECDF for one run. For uniform distribution, lines should be close to the diagonal.
multiRun.eachColorQq: Each color represents one run. Points should lie close to the diagonal line for uniform distribution.
multiRun.scrollPinTooltip: Scroll if needed · click chart to pin
multiRun.clickToCloseTooltip: Click chart or elsewhere to close
multiRun.clickToPinUnpin: Click to pin or unpin tooltip
multiRun.ecdfQqMetricsDesc: ECDF and Q-Q metrics across runs. Each run is normalized to [0, 1] before computing deviations against uniform.
multiRun.ksMadNote: K-S captures worst-point deviation; MAD captures average deviation across the ECDF.
multiRun.r2MseNote: R² measures how well points follow the diagonal; higher is better. MSE is average squared distance from y=x.

distributionSection.title: Distribution Shape Analysis
distributionSection.qqDiagonalNote: Points should lie along the diagonal line if uniformly distributed

independenceSection.title: Independence & Correlation Analysis
independenceSection.acfNote: Values near zero indicate independence. Significant peaks suggest correlation.

nistSection.title: NIST Statistical Tests
nistSection.binaryRepresentationNote: Tests performed on binary representation of numbers (IEEE 754 double precision)
nistSection.ieee754Note: Each number is converted to its IEEE 754 double precision (64-bit) binary representation
